So the game looks really solid. I was a huge fan of Evolve and thus like the idea of an asymetrical pvp game. However, this game specifically is not for me. I don't particularly like the horror theme of it, as my nerves are not of steel.

Also I only got this game to play with my brother. All in all solid game but not for me. Give it a shot, especially if you're a horror fan.

Recommending DBD is tough. On one hand, I have spend over 570 hours playing this game. On the other hand I've been more than frustrated for about 100 hours of those 570. 

Will you have fun playing this? Well, this largely depends on the people you are playing with / against. If your team is well-coordinated and is actually playing as a team, you can have the most thrilling and fulfilling experiences a multiplayer game can offer. 

If they don't rescue, leave you to die on your first hook, or (you as Killer) are incredibly good and just bully you, it's not that great.

You can have nice matches as a solo player. But it requires you to be quite decent at the game.

It stops being scary after about one hour. If you're looking for a "horror"-game, look elsewhere.

The game has been around for 5 years and it shows:
BHVR released a graphics update this year for free (because making DBD2 would cost them their playerbase).

There is a huge selection of Killers (OG and licensed) which is nice.

Newer Killers are usually incredibly boring to play against and not that original. 

I feel like the game got stale and what Dead by daylight really needs is actual competition. Which will be harder the more licensed killers they get their hands on. 

Also, don't think just because they have Resident Evil, Silent Hill and other licenses, that this game plays well. Every new Patch / Hotfix brings new hilarious and frustrating bugs into the game. Some bugs will not be adressed by the devs for months and months.

If you don't mind a toxic playerbase, are fine with your fun depending largely on other players, are fine with a periodically buggy mess of a game and devs who don't really care, ......., this game may be incredibly fun. 

I guess I recommend it for the moments, in which this game shines. Grab it during a sale and spend as little money as possible on it.

Das Spiel ist in ständiger Weiterentwicklung. Ein paar kleinere Macken hat es sicher noch, aber an sich ist es ein super lustiges Spiel. Egal, ob als KOOP mit Freunden oder Randoms - ich kann es sehr empfehlen.

Game can be fun when it works or when its being played with friends. The one thing that trumps all the Pros is the program used to patch the game. It has to be one of the worst things of human creation. Other games finish installing an patching in about 5-10 minutes... DBD? 30 minutes to an hour. Gotta be the most frustrating shit. (Edit) Upon the most recent update playing by yourself is a thing of the past even more now since you either get hard focused out of the game or your teammate gets downed an instantly disconnects.Just steer clear.

ziemlich coole Idee und gute Umsetzung. Wirklich etwas ''anderes'' zum zocken. Leider machen ein die ganzen ''Killer Camper'' das Spiel echt unerträglich. Wenn  der Killer die aufgehängten campt, hat man gar keine Chance ihn zu retten oder schlimmer, man wird dann auch getötet... schlimmste ist, dass man ständig die reportet, die das tun, und trotzdem NICHTS passiert dagegen. 
Vllt könnte man im Spiel eine ''Safezone'' installieren nach dem jemanden aufgehängt wurde, der Killer viele Punkte abgezogen bekommen, wenn er in diese Zone verbleibt....

Aber man hat stark das Gefühl, es ist wichtiger Addons oder sonstiges zu verkaufen, als wirklich etwas dagegen zu tun....

Oder wenigstens ein intergrietes Teamspeak im Spiel, wo man sich dann wenigstens absprechen könnte...aber nein das fehlt leider auch....

Ich für meinen Teil werde das Spiel löschen.

从18年玩第五人格开始接触到杀机，非对称公平竞技游戏的魅力深深吸引了我，每一个能力独特的杀手和人类都是这个游戏的精髓所在，如果你热爱非对称竞技类游戏，相信我，黎明杀机绝对不会让你失望，作为1v4游戏的巅峰之作，它绝对值得你来体验，当然，你也要忍受它的一些小缺点，比如搞笑的bug，还有暂时升高的血压（笑），但不管怎么说，以我单个玩家的角度来讲，黎明杀机，我心中永远的神！

Alright so, this game is one of those games that are so utterly terrible, but at the same time so addicting and enjoyable. I can never decide if I love or hate this game, its an abusive relationship. I'd recommed this game definitely if you enjoy the horror genre cause this game has it all, maps and characters from famous horror franchises that you get to play as, the horror fan dream! But as much as I enjoy this game, it has a lot of bugs, balancing issues etc. If you take this game too seriously you probably wont enjoy it as much as you could. It's just a game after all. Its a fun game with a shit ton of cool stuff, just some things are a bit bad, but every game has flaws. If you buy the game, I hope you'll enjoy it, and I'll see you in the fog~

I opened the box, and they came...

What I mean is my soul is basically doomed to the pits of hell because I'm responsible for other people playing this game. While I THOROUGHLY enjoy DBD, I can't in good conscience recommend it to anybody because of it's horrific monetization scheme.

There are very few survivor or killer options without buying DLC. Meta perks are locked behind said DLCs. Once you've reached this point, survivors are essentially the "worst" skin for that character and eventually, you're buying skins for your skins. 

Then an actual critical point to the game, the progression system (bloodweb) punishes you the more you invest into it. The more perks you unlock, the more it costs both in points and ridiculous amounts of time to get those perks on just a single character.

Long story short, when someone asks me about DBD, the first two things I say about it are, "Yeah, its fun as hell-" and "- but it costs too much money tho."

Most people would accomplish great things with a time machine. Stop a horrible event, save a loved one, maybe teach their younger self a lesson to put themselves on a better track, help an old friend that they weren't there for, maybe do the right thing for the "one that got away", or even do something like go back with the winning lottery number. 

Me? I'd go back in time and stop myself from ever trying this game.
